did.unittitle: Grace Naismith papers related to Roger Tory Peterson

bioghist.p: Grace Akin Naismith, was a consulting editor and writer with Reader's Digest from 1938 to 1971. She was the author of several books and numerous magazine articles. With John C. Devlin, she published a biography of Roger Tory Peterson. Peterson (1908-1996), was an American naturalist, ornithologist, artist, and educator, and held to be one of the founding inspirations for the 20th century environmental movement.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Grace Naismith and John C. Devlin materials related to their biography of Roger Tory Peterson entitled The World of Roger Tory Peterson (1977). Records in the collection include: typed manuscripts, many of them annotated; incoming and outgoing correspondence with Peterson, publishers, and interview subjects; memos from Peterson to Naismith and Devlin; research notes, articles, and clippings; audio tapes and transcriptions of interviews with Peterson and others; photographs of Peterson and his artwork; copies of speeches by Peterson; and reviews.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
